means: （使）醒( awaken的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: People were awakened rudely by a siren just outside their window.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们被窗外传来的汽笛声猛然惊醒了。

sentence.Network_en: He was snoring when Desmond awakened him.
sentence.Network_cn: 德斯蒙德叫醒他的时候他还在打呼噜呢。

sentence.Network_en: She awakened to the sound of birds singing.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 1.awakened超越你们富足的生活以及美好的梦想。觉醒者（awakened）授与吾等所求，历史的最后一页将为他所有，.
they were awakened by a weird shriek ., 他们被一声怪叫吵醒了.
I was awakened from my sleep by a fire bell ., 火警钟声把我从睡梦中惊醒.
the classic tale that awakened a nation about the slave system ., 经典的故事唤醒了一个民族关于奴隶制度.

awake 醒awaken to 醒悟awaken 唤醒

惊蛰（insects awaken）   和其他节气相同，惊蛰日期也和农历没有必然联系（2011年为二月初二）。   中国古代将惊蛰分为三候：“一 …

entry.def: To awaken a feeling in a person means to cause them to start having this feeling.

example.ex: The aim of the cruise was to awaken an interest in and an understanding of foreign cultures.
example.tran: 此次巡游旨在唤起我们对外国文化的兴趣和理解。

entry.def: When you awaken to a fact or when someone awakens you to it, you become aware of it.

example.ex: The British never awaken to peril until it is almost too late.
example.tran: 英国人从来不懂得防患于未然。

example.ex: ...the picture of the Earth, so blue and fragile, that awakened a generation to the Earth's mortality.
example.tran: 照片上的地球，如此的忧郁而脆弱，唤起了一代人对地球生命的意识

entry.def: When you awaken, or when something or someone awakens you, you wake up.

example.ex: Unfortunately, Grandma always seems to awaken at awkward moments...
example.tran: 不幸的是，奶奶好像总是醒来的不是时候。

example.ex: He was snoring when Desmond awakened him.
example.tran: 德斯蒙德叫醒他的时候他还在打呼噜呢。

auth_sentence.content: He stared in horror...his fear of pursuit awakened.

auth_sentence.content: You only know you were in it once you've awakened.
auth_sentence.res_content: You only know you were in it once you've awakened.

auth_sentence.content: Oh my God, Egypt has actually awakened, said Ikermawi.
